Fields.DialogueText: We've got Morganas coming out to play!
@BATTLE
The enemy has been taken care of, Kanchou. Not a single ship on the horizon.
Not a one? Are you sure?
Of course I'm sure. But if you don't believe me, you can always borrow my binoculars and check for yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, no, I remember what happened last time I used your binoculars.
That's okay. I trust your instincts, Kitakami.
Much appreciated.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, relax. I learned my lesson last time. You're not a fan of those kinds of jokes.
That means a lot. Thanks!
Look at that, I figured you'd still be a little hesitant to use anything of mine after last time.
All right. With the Morganas gone, we might actually have time to catch our breath.
If you've got some free time, then I've got the perfect idea for how you should spend it.
Perfect idea, huh? Perfect for me or for you?
For both of us! I just wanted to share some of the poetry I've been reading with you. We agreed to read it together, remember?
Of course I remember. But now's not really the best time.
Sounds like an excuse, but I'll give you a pass for now. You're a busy Kanchou, after all.
That I am. Thanks, Kitakami.
You don't smile enough, Kanchou.
Come again?
You should smile more! Most of this time you've got this stern, focused, expression, like you're thinking of something really important.
I'm probably thinking of the war we're in the middle of.
Still, your smile is really nice, and I think you should show it off more.
Why do I feel like you're leading me into some sort of trap?
Come on, don't be so paranoid. I just want a little smile. After all we've been through, it's not that much to ask.

Fields.MenuText: Fine. Here's a smile. Happy?
You can't smile on demand. That just makes it feel forced. It's gotta come out naturally.
My smile is nothing special. You know who has a terrific smile, though? You.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, that just looks forced, Kanchou. You look more in pain than anything.
Naturally, huh? So are you saying I should tell you a joke? Maybe I'll tickle you, heheh.
Oh, stop, you're just a flatterer - wait a minute, don't try to distract me! I wanna see that smile.
What has gotten into you, Kitakami?
I just want you to be happy. I want everyone onboard to be happy. Is that so wrong?
No, it's just that---
*ALARM*
Ah, here come the enemies of happy faces.
No one's gonna be smiling while we're dealing with these Morganas.
Another reason to destroy them!
@BATTLE
Things have been running pretty smoothly around here, haven't they?
I'd say so. You don't sound happy about that.
Hmph... I guess I just got too used to Kitakami's pranks. Without them... Eh, I don't know.
You sound like you have something you want to say. Feel free to speak your mind, I won't repeat it to anyone.

Fields.MenuText: No, this is war. I know we should be enjoying any peace we can get while we have it.
I'm just worried about crew morale. I feel like things have gotten less... exciting, maybe?
I'm happy the poetry helped to mellow out Kitakami, I am. I just can't stop worrying that she's just preparing the biggest prank yet.

Fields.DialogueText: You are correct, Captain. And it certainly is more peaceful now that our Belle has calmed down.
I don't think you have to worry about that, Kitakami is still keeping morale up, just without her usual methods. It's unusual for her, actually.
It sounds more like that's what you want. Do you want her to go back to her old ways?
I'm probably just being ridiculous, Kitakami has been fantastic lately. I'm really impressed with her, honestly.
Is she trying to force you to read poetry with her all the time?
No, not really. Why?
That's odd. Usually they'd be all she talks about. I expected her to be completely focused on them. Perhaps something else has caught her attention.
She has a bit of a one-track mind, huh?
You could say that. Once, when she was into bird watching, the ship would slow down whenever an eagle passed by. Her new hobby took precedence over everything else.
Bird-watching? I don't remember that.
It was long before you were captain. Before the war with the Morganas.
Wait... you mean before she was a Belle?
Yes. I've been an officer aboard her for quite some time.
*ALARM*
This is a conversation we're definitely going to finish later.
@BATTLE
That's the last of the paperwork. For now. I finally have a moment to relax and catch my breath.
Hey, Kanchou! What are you doing all by your lonesome? Looks like you could use some company.
I was just starting to relax, actually. But someone rudely interrupted that.
That's horrible - they should know better! You're the Kanchou, after all!
Heh, don't worry about it. I'd rather enjoy your company any---
Oh, have you gotten a chance to eat yet, Kanchou? We can't have your stomach growling in the middle of battle.
You're not my mother, Kitakami. I can feed myself.
That didn't answer my question.
... No, I haven't eaten yet.
Well, that's great, because neither have I. You can come with me and we can eat together.

Fields.MenuText: I'd be more than happy to have lunch with you. It sounds like fun.
I'm not even hungry yet. I promise I'll go when before I start starving, okay?
I can't shake the feeling that you've got something up your sleeve.

Fields.DialogueText: Doesn't it? There's also this new meal that I've been wanting to try, and I'm sure you're going to love it. It's supposed to be super healthy.
Fine... But make sure to bring me with you, just so I know you're actually eating enough.
Just good intentions. Come on, I'll prove it to ya!
*ALARM*
Funayūrei? Again with the horrible timing.
We'll eat after, okay?
Sounds like a plan!
@BATTLE
Who was it?
I miss my parents.
Oh, you--
*ALARM*
I guess I won't comment.
@BATTLE
So, Kitakami, have you heard any news from your nation?
I don't know. Not really, I guess.
What do mean? How could you not know what's going on back home?
I don't know 'cause it's not really that important. Is it?
It's just that usually during our meals, we'll chat about the situation back home.
That's so boring, though! Why talk about that when we could have an actual interesting conversation?!
But---
Pfft! Move on!

Fields.MenuText: It's her choice whether or not she wants to talk about her nation.
You really don't know what's happening back home?
Don't make faces at the table, Kitakami.

Fields.DialogueText: You're absolutely right, Kanchou! Take that! Kitakami wins!
Now you? Come on! It's so boring! Let's talk about music, or poetry, or something!
What face? This is just my normal face. Bleeeh! So is this. Heeeu! And this!
I'm sorry, Kitakami. If you don't want to talk about your home, then we don't have to.
That's more like it. But you got one thing wrong. My nation ain't my home. This is my home.
That's nice, Kitakami.
It's just how I feel.
Kanchou, I need your opinion on something!
Okay, let me just finish this paperwork first.
Hurry, it's important. Kai won't listen to reason.
You two get into another argument?
Eh, we're kind of always arguing, but, like, in a good way. Does that make sense?
The best friends are always arguing. If you weren't close then you wouldn't care what the other one thought.
That's exactly it, Kanchou. I knew I came to the right person to weigh in on this.
Weigh in on what, exactly? What are you arguing about this time?
What's your stance on cherry blossoms?

Fields.MenuText: What do cherry blossoms have to do with you and Kai?
I suppose they're pretty - but, other than that, is there a point to them?
They're beautiful.

Fields.DialogueText: It has to do with style, and the fact that Kai has none.
So you think they're pretty? That's exactly what I knew you'd say.
I know, right? Watching the cherry blossoms drift with the wind is one of life's simple pleasures. It's one of my favorite things to do when we're docked back home.
So don't you think I'd look really great with a splash of cherry blossom on my outfit?
That's what you two are arguing about this time? A design on your clothes?
It's a little more serious than that. I need to impress... the Morganas...
You want to impress the Morganas?
Before we blow them up, obviously. Wasn't it Sun Tzu who wrote, "What the ancients called a clever fighter is one who not only wins, but excels in winning with style?"
I'm... not sure that's quite right.
Only one way to find out. I can't wait to see how my new outfit looks!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you have a moment?
Always. What's going on?
I was just reading through my poetry and thought I'd come see if you'd like to join me.
I haven't had that much free time to read with you, have I? Thanks for not giving up on me.
No problem, Kanchou. You can make it up to me by joining me now!
Sounds like a plan. What are we reading?
I actually just finished this one I think you'd love! It's really powerful!
What's it called?
Lutany At Brink of Armageddon.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds rather... serious.
I'm guessing it's about sunshine and happy bunnies?
Maybe something else? I don't think I want to get depressed just now.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it is. In this time of war, people are afraid.
Wait? Are you serious? You really don't get poetry, do you?
Oh, come on, It's art. The fact that it can affect your emotions is the beautiful part of it.
Why don't you give me a brief summary? What's it about?
Well... it's about all the craziness the world is going through.
Like evil Morganas from unknown origins and the spirits of ships coming to life?
Well, I'm not sure the author had those in mind specifically, but... It's so impactful that I just have to read it for you, then you'll understand!
*ALARM*
I think after all these battles that I understand how insane the world is right now. I'm living in the thick of it.
But it's still such a great poem!
@BATTLE
I think today's the day!  The mail ship said on the radio that--
*ALARM*
Better do well in battle so I can get my package!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, look what got delivered!
I can't look at anything with you spinning around me like that. Could you stop? I'm getting dizzy.
Psh, you're no fun. You should be spinning with me. This is the time for celebration! We've practically defeated the Morganas already!
All right, I'm listening. How have we already beaten the Morganas?
Just look at my outfit. Remember that argument I was having with Kai over strategy?
Ah, I see now. You finally got your cherry blossom design. I'm still not quite sure that's a tactical advantage.
It totally is! Just wait until you see it in battle, Kanchou!
I'm sure.
Hey, you still haven't told me what you think! How do I look?

Fields.MenuText: It looks pretty good. I might even get a design like that for myself.
No matter how nice you might look, we have bigger things to worry about.
Personally, I think you look better in your old outfit.

Fields.DialogueText: Now there's an idea! I can totally picture this all over you... wait, I don't think that came out right!
So you mean I look nice? I'm glad you like it, Kanchou.
What?! All this effort and you preferred how I looked before? I'm... I'm a little flattered actually.
All right, now we've just got to go find some more Morganas so I can show you how completely tactical this design is.
You're pretty eager to get back to fighting.
I can't help it, I'm excited!
*ALARM*
Let me try a poem. "Fight with Kitakami, and you'll fight your last! I dress very pretty and move really fast!"
@BATTLE
Did you see me out there, Kanchou? I didn't even break a sweat fighting those Morganas! I'm stronger than ever before!
You weren't the only one fighting, Kitakami.
Well, sure, the crew was there too, but I've got to be one of the strongest Belles ever now!

Fields.MenuText: You may be strong, Kitakami, but you'd be nothing without the crew. You know that, right?
Sounds to me like you're getting a little cocky.
Please, there's no way we would've won that fight if it weren't for my magnificent leadership skills.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, of course I know that. Good job, everyone! Does that make you happy, Captain?
No way, that's not it! You saw the Morganas out there. They were quaking in fear as soon as they saw me.
Well, you are pretty magnificent. We make quite the powerful pair, don't we.
I still don't think your cherry blossom “armor” had anything to do with our victory.
You can't be serious! You really don't see it? The cherry blossoms make me at least ten times better in every way. Plus, the captain thinks I look good.
I'm pretty sure that's what you really care about. You're just trying to---
Not another word! Don't make me glue those loose lips shut! Again!
That's more like it. Now if you need me, I'll be washing my fantastic new outfit.
Has she actually done that before? Glue your mouth shut?
A couple times, actually.
Kitakami still hasn't gotten absorbed into her poetry?
You're straight to the point.
I always am. I'm just curious. She's acting differently than I'm ever seen her act before.
Well, she's reading it.
But it's not the only thing she can talk about, right?
No, not really.
That's just odd.

Fields.MenuText: Is it? She still seems like Kitakami to me - maybe just a little more pleasant.
You were really expecting her to go crazy about poetry? That sounds horrible.
She's always been pretty unusual. For one thing, she's about the least nationalistic Belle in the fleet...

Fields.DialogueText: Nicer, hmm? In all the time I've known Kitakami, she's never been this nice to be around before.
Poetry is the only thing she can stand to read. And when she reads it, she gets consumed by it. It becomes her whole world. Except not this time.
It's not that she doesn't care about Japan. It's just old hat to her, I think.
This isn't good. If I can't tell what's going on in her head... then I don't know how to help you deal with her.
I don't need help with that. I think I can handle Kitakami just fine.
Are you sure? I'd rather not lose another captain.
Another captain? What do you mean?
One of your predecessors took issue with some of Kitakami's eccentricities.
I tried to explain how her mood affected her performance, but he wasn't having any of it.
This was... before she was a Belle, right?
Yes. He thought I was being ridiculous. He didn't understand that she actually enjoyed it when I read her poetry in the engine room, or that she liked watching the birds fly overhead.
Don't worry. I definitely don't think it's ridiculous.
And if she wasn't a Belle?
*ALARM*
Morganas. We'll have to continue this conversation later.
Any time.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
"Morganas incoming, time to fight!  I'm sure it will work up an appetite!"
@BATTLE
Kanchou, ya hungry? It's time to eat.
Sure, I guess I could grab a bite.
Fantastic, it's a lot more fun eating together, isn't it? Come on, let's hurry and get a table together.

Fields.MenuText: Do we have to eat together? I sometimes prefer my alone time.
Yeah, I definitely prefer the company. Things are always interesting with you around.
You know, I know where the mess hall is, you don't have to pull me with you. We're practically holding hands, here.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, in that case, I can be really, really quiet. You won't even know I'm there, I swear!
Oh please, you're the interesting one. I'm just a normal, ordinary spirit of a warship.
I'm just escorting you, and my hand is nowhere near yours. If we were actually holding hands, that would be... I'm sorry, what were we talking about?
Hey, so, I've actually be meaning to talk to you about your behavior lately.
What? Did I do something wrong? I've been trying my absolute best. I mean, I know I might've been a little pushy about my new design, but---
You didn't do anything wrong, Kitakami, I'm just surprised by the sudden change.
It's not that strange, is it? I'm just trying to give you less to worry about. I want you to be able to depend on me.
Well, I do. You're the person I trust most on this ship, Kitakami.
Really? That means---I just... I don't know what to say. Thank you, Kanchou.
I hope you can trust me too.
Of course! I trust you so much! The most! I would trust you with anything!
That doesn't make any sense, Kitakami.
It's simple. By investing in me, you'll be investing in the war effort. You know I know how to handle money.
Usually, sure, but lately you've been a lot more concerned with how you look to a certain someone.
What are you trying to imply there?!
I do get it. It's you wanting to show off...
How could you say such a thing!?
I think it's pretty obvious what I'm trying to imply. Your little crush isn't exactly subtle...
Okay, that's it! I'm breaking out the glue!

Fields.MenuText: Uh oh, Kai, it sounds like you should start running.
What's going on this time? You two arguing about fashion again?
Did I hear correctly? Did something get crushed in here?

Fields.DialogueText: He can run, but there's nowhere he can hide.
It's more than fashion, this is about morale and fighting spirit.
Crushed? Oh, uh, yeah, I was smashing some bugs, I had to crush them all underfoot... Yeah, that's it.
Captain, do you think you could take her off my hands for a bit? I've got things to do, and maybe you'll be able to talk some sense into her.
Look, I'm just trying to make the crew happy, that's all.
I believe you. Come on, let's talk about it away from Kai. He clearly has work weighing him down.
I knew you'd understand, Kanchou. Come on, let's go talk in private.
Thank you.
You just have to know how to handle her.
@BATTLE
Miss Kitakami, I was just pushing through some requisition orders, and thought I'd ask if you needed anything. Maybe something from home?
Why would I want anything from Japan?
I, uh, I don't know. It's just a chance to get something you miss or something special.
So my country's special? Is that it?
I, ummm...
Captain, is my country special?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a fan of it. They've got really good snack food.
That question's relative, really. Do you think it's special?
It's a place like any other. So no.

Fields.DialogueText: So snack food is what makes a place special?
It's just a place. I don't see what the big deal about it is.
Exactly. I can always trust you to see it my way.
Japan is just where I came from, but lots of people come from there - that doesn't make it special. Where I am is far more important.
So, yeah. I think she doesn't want anything.
Right, my apologies.
Hopefully that's the last time that'll happen.
They're just trying to do something nice for you.
*ALARM*
If they want to do something nice, then they'll help get rid of this Morgana in record time. I was hoping to finish this book today.
I'm sure they'll do their best.
@BATTLE
Hey, Kanchou, wanna make a bet?
A bet? Where's this coming from?
Well, uh... I'm just curious about your... endurance. Yeah, that's it.
What do you mean?
I already know you're a great captain, and a terrific leader, but I'm curious how long you can... stay focused on Morgana positions.
... Sure. And what kind of bet are you suggesting?
Just a simple staring contest. Whoever blinks first loses and buys the winner a... gift.

Fields.MenuText: I guess I'll play along, but only because I know I'll win.
This seems like a waste of time to me, Kitakami.
Have we already started? Because you've been staring at me pretty intently for a while.

Fields.DialogueText: Please, I could stare into your eyes all day... wait, that sounds---I meant something different!
Sounds like someone is afraid of losing. It's okay if you don't want to play, I'll just start calling you Captain Chicken from now on.
Huh? I'm, uh, just practicing. I don't want to lose to you!
So should we count to three or---
*ALARM*
Nooooo!
We can stare at each other later, Kitakami, let's go.
Okay, but I'm holding you to that!
@BATTLE
Ha, there it is! You finally blinked, Kanchou!
What? No I didn't!
Yes you did, I saw it myself! Are you calling me a liar?

Fields.MenuText: No, of course not. I'm sure you wouldn't lie to me.
Maybe you just saw something you wanted to see. You really seem to want that gift.
Yeah, I am. I've never lost a staring contest. Never. I'm not even sure I've ever even blinked!

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, I wouldn't. Your trust means more to me than winning some silly contest.
Kanchou, don't you trust me? I wouldn't make something like this up for a gift.
Really? And you're calling me a liar? Everyone blinks!
So are you going to accept your obvious loss and buy me a present, or what?
I guess I have to.
Seriously? I wasn't actually expecting you to get me something!
If you had lost, wouldn't you have gotten me a gift?
Well, yeah, of course, but it was my idea. You don't... you don't have to get me anything if you don't want to, Kanchou. I don't wanna make you do anything.
I've already decided, Kitakami, I'm getting you something. I'm not sure what yet, but it'll come to me.
I'm sure I'll love whatever you get me!
@BATTLE
So, I hear you're getting Kitakami a present?
Yeah, it was a little contest I lost. The loser had to get the winner something. Did Kitakami tell you?
You could say that. It's all she'll talk about.
She's that excited about it?
Obviously. Can't really blame her with the way she feels about you.
What do you mean the way she feels about me?
You really have no idea, then. And I thought it was incredibly obvious. She has feelings for you, Captain. Romantic feelings.

Fields.MenuText: No way. Since when is Kitakami romantic?
She has feelings for me? That actually... makes some sense.
Really? I always thought she was more into you that way.

Fields.DialogueText: Kitakami is very in touch with her emotions, that being said, she's never been all that interested in love. Until she met you.
So you haven't been completely blind. That's good to hear.
Me? No, that would just be too weird. We've been friends for far too long!
How long has she been feeling this way?
I'm not sure - she didn't exactly tell me herself, it's just something I've noticed. Her change in behavior. It's because of you.
You think she's trying to impress me?
Something like that. I'd say she wants you to see her as a romantic interest as opposed to a rambunctious prankster.
Well, I mean...
Hmmm. Has it worked?
I don't know. I need some time to think about this.
@BATTLE
So you made the Captain promise to give you a gift, desu ne?
I did indeed! Promises were made, words of honor were offered - it's going to be fantastic!
Morganas approaching!  Better think of that later!
@BATTLE
Hey, Kanchou, where's my gift already? If you take much longer, I'm going to start thinking you forgot about me.
I didn't forget! This is just a big decision. I need to put some thought into this before I make any life-changing choices!
Whoa... You must be getting me one hell of a present. I can wait then, but I'm really looking forward to it!
Wait, what? I wasn't talking about...
Hey, Kitakami, can I talk to you about something for a second?
Hmmm? Sure!
Great, now I've got to get her an amazing gift too.
Why haven't you gotten her anything yet?
Because of what you told me! I'm worried that anything I get her could be misconstrued.
As?

Fields.MenuText: As a declaration of love.
As just a sign of friendship.
As... I don't know! I don't have the first damn clue how to handle this!

Fields.DialogueText: So you don't feel the same way?
So you want her to know you actually do harbor feelings for her?
Really? Well, if it makes you feel any better, I don't think she has a lot of experience either.
It sounds like you need to decide how you really feel about her first.
Yeah, but knowing Kitakami, she's not going to be that patient. She's pretty focused on getting a gift from me.
Then we have to distract her. I think I have an idea how to do that.
Hey, can I at least get a hint on what my present is going to be?
I, uh...
Hey, Kitakami, I've noticed you getting friendlier with the crew lately.
Hmm? Yeah, I've been making friends.
It must be because you haven't been playing any of your pranks for some time.
I... I suppose I haven't really thought about doing anything mischievous lately. What are you getting at?
Oh, nothing, I've just also noticed that some of the crew has relaxed around you, a little too much. I had to reprimand an officer yesterday for mishandling ammunition.
Really?
If you were in your old mood, you'd probably have taught him a lesson by gluing the box to his hands or something.
I'd be way more creative than that. And obviously I wouldn't play pranks with live ammunition, but there's plenty I could do with---
So you have been thinking about pulling some more pranks?
No, of course. That's behind me. You can trust me, Kanchou.
There's nothing wrong with a few well-deserved pranks. Especially if it teaches a lesson and keeps the crew in line. Right, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Kai is right. Pranks aren't bad. In moderation.
I kind of miss all your pranks, actually.
I've learned my lesson. I'm not getting in the middle of this argument.

Fields.DialogueText: I... guess you have a point.
You miss them? Really?! I've kinda been missing them too.
Don't worry, you don't have to jump into this argument, Kanchou. I already know what you think about the topic, anyway.
You might be wrong about that, Kitakami. Right, Captain?
Well... The crew could stand to gain a few things if you started up your tricks again.
... I'll see you two later. I've got some preparations to make.
I feel like we may have just made a big mistake.
Then figure out how you feel already. The faster you do, the less time she has to terrorize the ship.
@BATTLE
"I'll turn these Morganas into wrecks, and Kai I will attend to next!"
@BATTLE
Great, Kai, I was hoping for some advice on what to get Kitakami.
I'd be happy to help. Does this mean you know how you feel about her?
Not exactly, but I'd like to know what gift says, “Be mine.” And what gift says, “Be my friend.” You know?
Makes sense.
Uh... Should I take a seat too? I mean, you don't really have to, but most officers stand up and face their captain when they're speaking to them.
I... wish I could, but I can't remove my hands from this table.

Fields.MenuText: Was this some sort of arts and crafts accident?
It's started, hasn't it?
We're going to have to remove them then. I'll grab some anesthetic. You're going to want to be out for this.

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly. Kitakami just got me good. I'm at least thankful she didn't use the rat.
Yup. She called me “Sticky-Fingers” before running out of here, laughing hysterically.
That really won't be necessary, I'm sure it will dissolve in time.
You still think this was a good idea?
Just hurry up and realize how you feel about her. Before this backfires even worse.
How much worse could it get?
You're going to be so proud of me, Kanchou.
I think that's for me to decide. What'd you do?
Why are you asking that with such a worried expression? I'm just giving the crew a little nudge of energy.
So you've been pulling pranks around the ship then?
Oh yeah, so many! I didn't realize how much I was missing it.
You look so happy right now.
Thank you? I like to think I'm usually pretty happy, though.
Yeah, you are, but your smile... It's been a while since I've seen you with such a huge smile.
Shut up! You're making me feel self conscious.
Sorry... I just... If it makes you so happy then why did you stop pranking everyone in the first place?
Well, I, uh... I was starting to worry I was becoming a nuisance for you, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I would never consider you a nuisance.
Sometimes you were a handful, but it's part of your charm.
I'm surprised something like that would stop you.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I'm pretty sure a lot of people think of me that way.
You think I'm charming? Well, I suppose a charming nuisance is better than an annoying one.
Usually it wouldn't, but...
I usually don't care at all what people think about me. I just do what I want to do. I do whatever makes me happy. But... I care what you think about me, Kanchou.
I... Well, I only think good things. You can be sure of that.
Thank you, Kanchou. I---
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Just when I was working up the courage.
Courage?
T-to face the Morganas! Obviously! Let's go!
@BATTLE
So, Kitakami, I haven't been getting any reports about your pranks. Are you sure you've been up to your old games?
Yeah, but like I always say, who doesn't love a good prank?! We always laugh and have a good time afterward. A lot of them say they'll get me back.
I assume the officers with the angry scowls would be the ones swearing vengeance?
When you say it like that, you make them sound menacing. I welcome the challenge! You know I've never been got before.
What exactly have you been doing to the crew, Kitakami?
Okay, well, I turned every pair of that officer's pants into shorts. He must've borrowed those pants from a friend.
That's a little much, but not horri---
I tickled that guy until he peed his pants.
... You what?
I filled her bed with scorpions!
That's definitely not okay!
They were fake!

Fields.MenuText: Excellent work, Kitakami. Keep it up.
Maybe tone it down a little.
Yup... This was a mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kanchou! See, the captain approves, Kai!
So... I shouldn't make an itty bitty leak below deck?
Hmmm... I guess you're right. I should've gone all out and used the real scorpions.
Hearing about all this, it makes me glad I just had to deal with a little glue.
Hehehe, that was just the start. I've got plans.
You may be worse than the Morganas.
Oh, don't be a baby! You know you're having fun.
@BATTLE
Definitely not!
I'm joking, Kanchou.  Really.
Hmmm... So this is her present?
Yeah, you think it'll show her how I feel?
You mean that you feel the same way she does?
Yes. You don't have to say it so loud, though. I'd like her to know before the rest of the ship.
Of course. You might have to explain it to her a little. Complex things can sometimes go over her head.
It's not that complex, is it?
We'll find out after you give it to her. You nervous?

Fields.MenuText: Of course. Wouldn't you be?
Not really. I already know how she feels. That takes away a lot of the anxiety.
Honestly, I'm trying not to think about it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure. I've never been in love before.
That makes sense. The most nerve-wracking part about matters of the heart is the uncertainty. Or so I hear.
Distracting yourself to keep the butterflies out of your stomach? Smart. I'll have to keep that tactic in mind if I ever find myself falling for someone.
Have you really never been in love?
No. It wasn't that long ago that I was just a crazy guy talking to a ship. So it makes sense that I'd be a little lonely, doesn't it?
When you put it that way...
I haven't given up yet though. That special person could be just around the corner.
That's the spirit. And if it means anything, I don't think you're crazy.
I appreciate it, Captain. Now, haven't you spent enough time cheering me up? Shouldn't you be preparing for Kitakami?
You're right again. Wish me luck.
@BATTLE
Kitakami, can I have a moment of your time?
Oh no, have you started getting complaints? I knew the human aquarium was too much.
The what?
I... trapped a few officers in a glass case. Like an aquarium... You mean you didn't hear about that?
No, but I think I probably should've. They're not still trapped in there, are they?
Nah, don't worry, I let 'em out. If that's not what you wanted to talk about, then what's up?
I know you're just trying to change the subject, but I'm okay with that because I have your present.
Oh, that's right! I almost completely forgot! You still. Owe. Me. A. Present.
Ow, you don't have to jab at me so hard. I told you, I have it.
Yeah, but you took your sweet time getting it. Now gimme!
Not so fast, I'd like to give it to you in private. Think you could meet me in my office in a bit.
Uh, sure, I guess. Is this like a super-secret special present or something?

Fields.MenuText: No, there's nothing special about it. I'm just a private person.
Maybe. You'll have to wait to find out.
Yes. It's the most super-secret special present you could ever imagine.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, well - that's no fun.
Oooh, mystery. I like it.
That's a tall claim. You better not disappoint me.
*ALARM*
Of course they attack now.
Dangit! I'm gonna blow these guys up extra hard. I was about to get my gift!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I'm here - where's my present?!
Take a seat. I'll pull it out for you.
Ooooh, I'm so excited. I can't wait! Just give it to me already!
Hey, Kitakami, you're an amazing person, you know that?
Uh, thanks? Where'd that come from all of a sudden?

Fields.MenuText: What, I can't give you a compliment now?
Sorry, that was random wasn't it?!
Well, I wrote down a whole speech, but I can't seem to find it. So I'm just saying whatever comes to mind.

Fields.DialogueText: No, your compliments are always appreciated.
A little, but not in a bad way. A little randomness is good now and then.
You wrote out a speech? That's weird. Speaking from the heart is always the best anyway.
I've just been thinking about you a lot. Trying to come up with the perfect gift to give you. The perfect present to show you how I feel about you.
How you... feel about me? What, uh, what do you mean by that, Kanchou?
Here. Hopefully this will communicate my feelings.
Oh, a... What is this? An Ogre Mask? I'm... not really sure what this is supposed to tell me...
Heh, gotcha!
What?
I pulled a prank on you. Now you've officially been got.
This is a prank? This has all just been a trick?!
Not all of it. Flip the mask over.
Hmph. An arrow? Oh, this is lovely. This jade is beautifully carved. It's so delicate looking.
It was practically a steal. I wasn't sure if you'd actually like how it looked, but I was sure you'd appreciate the investment.
You know me well. I'm sure I could sell this for... maybe five times what you paid for it.
Really?
But I won't. This is priceless to me. Because it's from you. And this scary ogre mask too. I'm keeping them both!
I mean, you can, but you don't really have to.
No, I'd never throw away a present from you, Kanchou!
I'm glad to hear that...  Kitakami, I... I have feelings for you. If that wasn't obvious already.
You---I---Really?!
Yes, real---
*ALARM*
Dammit. Morganas.
Forget about them. This is more important!
Maybe to us, but... The rest of the crew might think otherwise.
Ugggh!  I hate when you're right, sometimes! Lets go. We're finishing this conversation afterwards. I have something important to tell you after all.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
"One more fight, and after this, Kanchou and I will be filled with bliss!"
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I love you!
Did you hear me? I said I love you. Stop smiling like a goof and say something!

Fields.MenuText: I love you too.
I know.
Sorry, I can't hear anything. I think I was too close to an explosion.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Okay, now I'm smiling like a goof!
You do? How?!
Then why do you look so happy! Don't be so mean, Kanchou!
I'm glad you said it, Kitakami.
How are you so together? I expected you to be totally surprised!
Well, I may have known for some time now.
Was I that obvious?
In hindsight? Yes. But Kai actually let me know.
He what? That idiot! I'm going to need worse than glue for the next time I see him.
Maybe give him a little slack? I mean, he did help me realize my feelings for you.
What are those feelings, again?
You know.
I wanna hear you say it again.
I love you.
Eeek, you said it! I love you too!
